summary.intent: Redesign the CompactActionSummary component in RemediationHistoryCard to group actions by target file instead of a flat list, remove the strategy badge, and add a dedicated Skipped section at the bottom.
summary.outcome: The redesign was implemented successfully in a single file edit, all 1290 tests passed, lint was clean after a fix pass, and the change was committed.

repo: The project uses `bun` as the runtime/package manager and `rtk` as a wrapper for commands in the remote dev environment.
Biome is used for linting (not ESLint), with `bun run lint:fix` available for auto-fixing.
RemediationAction objects already carry `file`, `status`, and `summary` fields — no backend changes were needed for this UI grouping feature.
The codebase uses a slate color system for UI styling, consistent across components.

code.finding: CompactActionSummary function — previously rendered all actions as a flat list mixing target files and strategies. Now groups addressed actions by action.file (alphabetical, 'General changes' last) with monospace group headers and a flat Skipped(N) section at the bottom. Strategy badge (outputType) removed entirely.

workflow: The implementation flow was: read file → single edit → run tests → run lint → run lint:fix → commit. Lint required a fix pass after the edit.
Using `bun run test 2>&1 | tail -20` and `bun run lint 2>&1 | tail -20` to capture only relevant output is a useful pattern for large test suites.
Pre-planned implementations with explicit line ranges and pseudocode allow single-shot edits without iterative back-and-forth.

friction: Lint did not pass on the first attempt after the edit — a `bun run lint:fix` pass was required to clean up formatting/style issues introduced by the new code.
open_items: Visual verification in browser was listed as a required step in the plan but does not appear to have been performed during the session — the grouped layout and skipped section should be manually verified with real remediation data containing mixed file targets.
